content: I think I'll start by researching professional associations like the National Association of Watch and Clock Collectors and the American Watchmakers-Clockmakers Institute to find certified appraisers in my area. I'll also ask around in local antique shops and auction houses to see if they know of any reputable appraisers who specialize in vintage pocket watches. Do you think it's a good idea to get my pocket watch appraised by multiple experts to get a more accurate assessment of its value?
